title: The Partridge Family creator Bernard Slade dies aged 89
text:
Bernard Slade has died (Pictures: Getty/REX)

The creator of The Partridge Family, Bernard Slade, has died at the age of 89.

The TV writer and playwright was known as the mastermind behind the iconic 1970s TV series, which starred Shirley Jones as the matriarch of the fictional family singing group.

According to The Hollywood Reporter, Slade died peacefully at his Beverly Hills home from complications of Lewy body dementia, a family rep confirmed on Wednesday.

Lewy body dementia is the second most common type of progressive dementia after Alzheimer’s. It occurs when protein deposits develop in nerve cells in the brain regions involved in thinking, memory, and movement.

The Patridge Family, arguably his biggest legacy, ran for four seasons, launching the career of the late-David Cassidy and his profile as teen heartthrob for millions, while also cementing the star status of Danny Bonaduce and Susan Dey.

Slade – full name Bernard Slade Newbound – was also known for developing The Flying Nun and The Girl With Something Extra, which both stared Hollywood legend Sally Field.

He was also the story editor and wrote 17 episodes for beloved sitcom Bewitched, starring Elizabeth Montgomery.

In 1978 Slade was nominated for an Oscar for his screen adaptation of Same Time, Next Year, his play of the same name, which was a Broadway hit.

The Partridge Family ran for four seasons (Picture: Rex Features)

He was also a prolific Broadway writer (Picture: Toronto Star)

He had immense luck on Broadway, with his second show Tribute, starring Jack Lemmon, running for 200 performances. Following Lemmon’s departure, Slade’s 1979 Romantic Comedy, starring Mia Farrow, lasted nearly 400 performances.

His final Broadway play, Special Occasions, was produced in 1982.

Slade was married to actress Jill Foster for 64 years up until her death in 2017.

He’s survived by his sister Shirley; his children, Laurie and Chris; and his granddaughters, Caitlin, Madison, Emma and Hailey.

Plans for a memorial will be announced and, according to The Hollywood Reporter, in lieu of flowers, the family requests donations be sent to The Actors Fund.
description: The Partridge Family creator Bernard Slade dies aged 89 after battle with Lewy body dementia.
